citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Rodent feces was observed around and under unopened dry dog food bags in the food storage room. While the facility
has rodent traps in place, they are not an effective method of pest control at this time. The presence of mammal pests
may create a disease hazard to the animals. An effective program for the control of insects, external parasites, avian and
mammalian pests must be established and maintained. The licensee discussed with inspectors possible remedies to the
pest control issue during the inspection.
To be corrected by: 30-January-2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Jennifer Walker, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.11(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Rodent feces was observed around and under unopened dry dog food bags in the food storage room. While the facility 
has rodent traps in place, they are not an effective method of pest control at this time. The presence of mammal pests 
may create a disease hazard to the animals. An effective program for the control of insects, external parasites, avian and 
mammalian pests must be established and maintained. The licensee discussed with inspectors possible remedies to the 
pest control issue during the inspection. 
To be corrected by: 30-January-2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Jennifer Walker, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
